content:
Diagnosis:	T2N0M0 squamous cell carcinoma of right oral tongue

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Wide local excision and selective neck dissection
		12/4/24 Started adjuvant radiotherapy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, 2.8cm diameter, depth of invasion 8mm, clear margins (>5mm), no lymphovascular invasion. 0/21 nodes positive.

Current Situation:	Week 4 of adjuvant radiotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today during week 4 of adjuvant radiotherapy. Treatment has been well tolerated with grade 2 mucositis managed with regular analgesics and mouth care. Weight has remained stable at 72kg with dietetic support. No issues with mask fitting or positioning. Examination shows expected radiation-induced changes in oral cavity but no concerning features. Blood tests remain satisfactory.

The plan is to complete the remaining radiotherapy as scheduled. We will review again in clinic next week. I have prescribed additional oral morphine solution for breakthrough pain management.
